column4: Hi, I try to mount a partition and since a weed all i get s mount: special device /dev/hda2 does not exist
ide devices are now called sda
: there is no /dev/sd* file... beside the /dev/hda1 is mounting perfectly
which release?
dapper or..?
: gutsy
not the kind of thing that usually gives trouble - does 'sudo fdisk -l /dev/hda' show the partition?
: yes, fdisk shows them both
and nothing funky going on here?
I'm assuming /dev/hda2 won't mount?
: yes, fdisk shows them both
does it mount?
: no, it says the device doesn't exist
ls -l /dev/hda[12]
: only hda1 is seen
what kind of file system on hda2 ?
: fat32
how big is hda1 ?
: about 150 GB but that's not the problem.. until 2 weeks ago i could mount hda2 normally
you have LBA enabled in the bios?
: i don't know, but I haven't changed the BIOS recently
: did you reply anything? I can't scroll back
